intro: Fagara culantrilo, commonly known as the bitter apple or poisonwood, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a yellowish, fleshy berry containing several seeds. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals.
